Cell¶

class Cell

Represents a cell inside of a universe.

Public Functions

Cell()

Default constructor used in rings/sectors subdivision of cells.

Cell(short int universe, short int id = 0)

Constructor sets the unique and user-specifed IDs for this cell.

Parameters
  • id -

    the user-specified cell ID

  • universe -

    the ID of the universe within which this cell resides

~Cell()

Destructor frees all surfaces making up cell.

short int getUid()

Return the cell’s unique ID.

Return
the cell’s unique ID

short int getId()

Return the cell’s user-specified ID.

Return
the cell’s user-specified ID

cellType getType()

Return the cell type (FILL or MATERIAL).

Return
the cell type

short int getUniverse()

Return the ID of the universe within which this cell resides.

Return
the universe ID

short int getNumSurfaces()

Return the number of surfaces in the cell.

Return
the number of surfaces

std::map< short int, Surface * > getSurfaces()

Return the hashtable of surfaces IDs and surface pointers for all surfaces making up the cell.

Return
map of surface IDs and surface pointers

int getNumFSRs()

Return the number of flat source regions in this cell.

This method is used when the geometry recursively constructs flat source regions.

Return
the number of FSRs in this cell

void setUniverse(short int universe)

Set the ID for teh universe within whic this cell resides.

Parameters
  • universe -

    the universe’s user-specified ID

void addSurface(short int halfspace, Surface * surface)

Insert the a surface into this cell’s container.

Parameters
  • halfspace -

    the surface halfspace (positive/negative for surface side)

  • surface -

    a pointer to the surface

void setSurfacePointer(Surface * surface)

Registers a surface pointer with the Cell‘s surfaces map.

This method is used by the geometry whenever a new cell is added to it.

Parameters
  • surface -

    the surface pointer

bool cellContainsPoint(Point * point)

Determines whether a point is contained inside a cell.

Queries each surface inside the cell to determine if the point particle is on the same side of the surface. This point is only inside the cell if it is on the same side of every surface in the cell.

Parameters
  • point -

    a pointer to a point

bool cellContainsCoords(LocalCoords * coords)

Determines whether a point is contained inside a cell.

Queries each surface inside the cell to determine if the particle is on the same side of the surface. This particle is only inside the cell if it is on the same side of every surface in the cell.

Parameters
  • coords -

    a pointer to a localcoord

double minSurfaceDist(Point * point, double angle, Point * min_intersection)

Computes the minimum distance to a surface from a point with a given trajectory at a certain angle.

If the trajectory will not intersect any of the surfaces in the cell* returns INFINITY.

Parameters
  • point -

    the point of interest

  • angle -

    the angle of the trajectory (in radians from 0 to 2*PI)

  • min_intersection -

    a pointer to the intersection point that is found

std::string toString()

Convert this cellfill’s attributes to a string format.

Return
a character array of this cell’s attributes

void printString()

Prints a string representation of all of the cells’s objects to the console.
